comments:
In the debug perspective, when a debug session is in running state, maximize 
any view.  Then, restore the maximized view to its original size.  Got an error 
from Launch View:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-03-30 21:54:18.506
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Initialize Debug View".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchView.findFrame
(LaunchView.java:451)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchView.access$5
(LaunchView.java:443)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchView$3.run
(LaunchView.java:417)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Hmmm. Looking at the code, I'm not sure how this is possible. Does this happen 
consistently?

Yes, this happens consistently.  Looks like it happens when the Debug View does 
not have any stack frame to display.

Samantha, do you have a test case for this?
On 3/30 LaunchView line 451 was "if (threads[i].getBreakpoints().length > 0) {" getBreakpoints() returns 
an zero length array if there are no breakpoints and threads[i] shouldn't be null. I don't see where the 
NPE could be coming from.

Hi Kevin -

Hi Kevin,

Attached is the new stacktrace.  I reproduced with my dummy adapter.  I think 
it is a problem with my adapter that the thread returns null on getBreakpoints
().  Since I didn't do any breakpoint code in my adapter, it didn't occur to me 
that the generated code was causing problem.  (sorry)  Changing my code to 
return an empty array on getBreakpoints() solved the problem.  I think it's ok 
to close this bug.

Thanks...
Samantha
